titles.title: Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” / Mäwaśǝʾt zä-fälasǝyan, Antiphonary for the hermits / Mǝʿǝraf, The Common of the Office / Dǝggwa, Antiphonary

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 3ra-18rb) II) Mäwaśǝʾt zä-fälasǝyan, Antiphonary for the hermits (fols. 19ra-22rb) III) Ṣälotä kidan zä-śälästu gizeyat “Covenant of the three hours”, introductory prayer in ʾararay-mode (fol. 22va-vb)(MQ, Śǝrʿatä qǝddase, ch. III, § 174) IV) Mǝʿǝraf, The Common of the Office (fols. 23ra-36vb) IV-1) Wazema, The Office of Vigils (fols. 23ra-26va) IV-2) Kǝśtät zä-ʾaryam, The festive Office (fols. 26vb-36vb) V) Dǝggwa, Antiphonary (for the feasts of the year) (fols. 38ra-120v)
Additio 1.

dcomments.dcomment: Second half of the 17th cent. - first half of the 18th cent. (?)

txstates.txstate: The sewing was crudely repaired. The spine shows concave distortion. Fol. 4 has been reinserted sideways. Fol. 69 is loose. Many fols. are stained with dirt and water. Edges of some fols. are damaged. Holes are carefully amended on fols. 17 and 26.

bindings.binding: Two leather boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: A small hole is visible in the centre fold of the quires above the 1st sewing station.

squires.squire: The structure of the quires cannot be established due to the poor condition of the Ms.

taunit.rl-info:
Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The bottom ruled line of fol. 12rv has not been used.
Ruling and pricking are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0. Primary pricks are not visible. Ruling pricks are not visible. Horizontal ruling lines are not visible

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Second half of the 17th cent. - first half of the 18th cent. (?)

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; title and incipit of daily readings of Text I; refrains of Text I (written out fully or abbreviated); numbers of Pss. in Text II; names of sections of antiphons and their abbreviations (mǝlṭan and mäzmur) in Text II; initial line of Text III; titles of Texts IV and V; names of supplications, antiphons and chants, and their abbreviations (e.g., mästäbqʷǝʿ, mǝlṭan, mäzmur, sälam, ʾaryam) of Text IV; names of feasts of Text IV; names of sections followed by feast names (e.g., wazema zä-mäsqäl, wazema zä-ʾarbaʿǝtu ʾǝnsǝsa) of Text IV; names of antiphons and their abbreviations (e.g., maḫlet, mäzmur, śäläst, sälam, bä-5-tu, ʾabun, ʾaryam, ʾǝsmä lä-ʿaläm, zä-ʾamlakiyä, zä-yǝʾǝze, yǝtbaräk); names of other chants and their abbreviations (e.g., mǝlṭan, mǝsbak, ʿǝzl); intratextual musical signs (e.g., ʿararat mäḥa, ḥaḍä, wäy, läkä sǝ, qädami zema); elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.
Two lines (alternating with a black line) on the incipit page of Texts I, IV and V.

abbreviations.abbreviation: Text I ሰ፡/ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት (fols. 3rb-18ra) Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain: ሠረቀ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fol. 3ra-rb) እስ፡/እስመ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 3va-7va) ኵሉ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 8ra-9vb) ናዓ፡ for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 11va-12va) ለኪ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (fols. 13rb-14ra) ተፈ፡/ተፈሥ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 15rb-16rb) ወበ፡/ወበእ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 17rb-18ra) Texts II-IV ም፡/ምል፡/ምልጣ፡ for ምልጣን፡ ተሣ፡ እ for ተሣሃለነ: እግዚኦ ቅ፡ እ፡ ቅ፡ ኃ፡ ቅ፡ ሕ for ቅዱስ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ቅዱስ፡ ኃያል፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሕያው መስተ፡/መስተብ፡ for መስተብቍዕ፡ ይትባ፡/ይትባረ፡ for ይትባረክ፡ መዝ፡/መዝሙ፡ for መዝሙር፡ ዘይእ፡ for ዘይእዜ፡ ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡ ሃ፡ for ሃሌሉያ

additional.cont: Fol. 117vb: ˀAsmat-prayer.
additional.add: Fol. 117vb: በስመ፡”…ወመንፈስ፡…በስሙ፡ ለአብ፡ አብሹሉሽ፡ በስሙ፡ ለወልድ፡ ጠብሹሉሽ…
additional.det: The text is crudely written, perhaps in the same hand as that of the writing exercises appearing elsewhere in the Ms.

extras.extra: - Tämälläs-signs, in the shape of two perpendicular lines, indicating the place where the omissions, written in the upper margin, belong, in the main hand: fols. 8vb l.8, 14ra l.12, 17rb l.7, 23vb l.9, 25ra l.7, 26rb l.2, 28ra l.15, 28va l.9, 31va l.15, 35ra l.7, 36ra l.7, 39va l.7, 40vb l.9, 42vb l.14, 51va l.9, 53ra l.7, 57ra l.3, 69va l.11, 70vb l.4, 72ra l.6, 73rb l.7, 75ra l.2, 76ra l.5, 80rb l.7, 80va l.3, 81rb l.4, 81va l.3, 84rb l.12, 85va l.11, 93va l.9, 95ra l.5, 95rb l.15, 98ra l.15, 98va l.12, 100ra l.3, 109rb l.13, 109vb l.8, 112ra l.8, 115rb l.7, 116rb l.3. - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of a cross, indicating the place where the omission, written in the upper margin, belongs, in a secondary hand: fol. 20va l.11. - The scribe used a compressed script on fol. 36vb. - Two small crosses are drawn in the margins of fol. 84v. - A note has been erased from fol. 117rb. - Scribbles, writing exercises (in Ethiopic syllabary): fols. 1rv, 2r, 18v, 22rb, 37rv, 80vb, 117va, 121r-122v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: A red thread is inserted in the right upper corner of fol. 18.
